channel.title: Hurdat on Tim Trice
channel.description: Recent content in Hurdat on Tim Trice

item.title: Introducing rrricanes, HURDAT
item.description: I’m proud to introduce two new packages for the R community: HURDAT and rrricanes. Both packages are complimentary to one another. HURDAT is a dataset of tropical cyclones that have developed in the Atlantic and northeast Pacific oceans since 1851 and 1949, respectively. HURDAT is a re-analysis project as conducated by the Hurricane Research Division of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. They review known data to determine the best track, intensity and structure of a cyclone.

item.title: HURDAT 0.1.0
item.description: Installation Included Datasets Atlantic (AL) Northeast Pacific (EP) Variables Data Quality HURDAT is a R package based off the Hurricane Re-Analysis Project by the Hurricane Research Division. The package contains two datasets; one for Atlantic Ocean cyclones and one for northeastern Pacific cyclones. Installation HURDAT requires R version 3.4.0 or greater. install.packages("HURDAT") library(HURDAT) # Additional libraries used for this document library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(Hmisc) library(knitr) library(purrr) library(readr) Included Datasets The raw dataset is updated annually; typically during late winter or spring.
